snippet: Americans belonging to the faith said their turbans and beards seemed to trigger violence since Sept. 11 by people ignorant of their religion.
abstract: Sikhs in New York and across the country mourn the deaths in the shooting rampage at a Wisconsin temple; some Sikhs say that their turbans and beards have triggered harassment and violence since Sept 11 by people ignorant of their religion.

byline.contributor: Sarah Maslin Nir, Sharon Otterman and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Americans belonging to the faith said their turbans and beards seemed to trigger violence since Sept. 11 by people ignorant of their religion.

headline.seo: Sikhs Mourn Victims and Lament Post-9/11 Targeting
headline.main: Mourning Victims, Sikhs Lament Being Mistaken for Radicals or Militants
headline.print_headline: Mourning Victims, Sikhs Lament Being Mistaken For Radicals or Militants
